result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

01:40 PM Defendant Donald Harmon in court, in custody, with attorney James Edgar Toran.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Attorney James Toran

Hearing on April 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:08 PM Defendant Donald Harmon in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Mr. Longoria states the defendant is planning to retain attorney James Toran.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court notes a defect within the Criminal Complaint.  The Court strikes paragraph two of the criminal complaint which may be addressed at a later date.  Defendant to seek counsel.  Court notes the defendant is currently on a probation and parole hold and will set this matter back on Friday for a status of counsel date to ensure the defendant is able to retain attorney Toran.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
